Entries.default: "Back up. No shops this way, stranger." The thug holds up surprisingly smooth hands, stepping in front of you.
"Delver's Row has plenty to offer. But it's that way." He extends a well-manicured finger to point over your shoulder. His other hand rests on the hilt of his weapon.
"You [Player Name]? Dereo said you can pass."
"Get him!"
"Go on. Lift takes you to the Undercroft."
"What are you guarding?"
"How do I get permission to pass?"
[Attack] "I go where I please."
[Leave.]
"You think I'm standing here so I can tell you about it? Come on, go." He flicks his fingers in a shooing motion. His nails shine in the torchlight.
"That's up to Dereo." He drums his long nails against his hip.
[Show the suolenet.]
"My mistake. Please." He steps out of your path, extending a delicate hand toward the lift.
Recognition flashes in his eyes.
"If you say so. Only way you're getting by is with Dereo's approval."
"Where might I find Dereo?"
[Lie] "Dereo sent me with a message for Morena."
"Once you leave the Row, go right from the stall, left at the crossroads, then down the alleyway."
He snorts. "Like I've never heard that one before."
"I'm looking for Mad Morena. She works in the Undercroft."
"How's this for 'approval'?"
"Coin's no good to a dead man. And there's not enough money in Neketaka for me to risk crossing Dereo." He flips your coin back into your hand.
[Show the medallion.] "Any chance this will get me past you?"

"I don't even have to glance at that to tell you the answer is no."

He glances anyway, squinting.
"Still no."
"What are YOU doing up here?" He hisses at Tekēhu, looking him over.

"Ekera, to... survey the local... established..." 

Tekēhu thinks better of saying anything and closes his mouth.
"Well, get downstairs before anyone sees you." He tips his head and moves to step out of Tekēhu's way.
Passing you an uncertain glance, Tekēhu takes a hesitant step forward.
"What about me?"
"Where does this lead?"
[Let him go.]
"What ABOUT you?" He looks you up and down, then turns his attention back to Tekēhu.
As Tekēhu moves ahead, the guard holds out his hand once more.
"Hold a moment. I'd remember that face." He squints at Tekēhu, nodding slowly.
"If you have to ask..." He looks between you and Tekēhu
"You were about to let him go downstairs. Why?"
"Just let my friend here go down. We can wait."
[Say nothing.]
"That's not how this works."
"Explain your business or turn around. I've had enough games for one day."
He grimaces at you both, his hand closing around his weapon.
"The silent treatment is wasted on me, friend."
"You do not have a tongue for compliments, I say."
"You don't belong down here." He taps his long nails against the hilt of his weapon.
"If you see svef stains on the floor, you're going the right way."
"It's your neck."
"What's with the dead godlike back there?"
"Captain Tatzatl sent his godlikes to fetch a prisoner. Seems the fellow gave them more trouble than they expected." He smirks.
"They finally got him aboard the Divine Barge, though. Probably halfway to Dunnage by now."

"Cuè?! Madi-"

Pallegina cuts herself short and pulls you aside.
"I'm here on behalf of Captain Aeldys."
